column4: freezing under ubuntu and xp....memory tests ok.....could this be caused by hard drive problems???
temp - did you assemble the system, or get it assembled and did you or the assembler forget the paste for the processor?
also try reducing the cpufrew to 1/2 in the bios and see if that fixes it for a day or two - that way you might know its the temp issue, or not.
anything in the syslog, dmesg etc?
also re-seat pci card, memory etc
